result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Kyle P Anderson in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. Jonathan Reinke from WCS present by Zoom videoconference.
Att Rumpf advises that the Defendant had made a sizable payment, and that the matter should be considered resolved for now. Att Rumpf advises that the Defendant can continue to pay $100.00 every two weeks going forward.
Mr. Reinke advises that the Defendant has made that payment, and raises no further issue.

[MK] cases #22CF166 and #22TR2210 called at 9:51am 
Defendant Kyle P Anderson in court with Attorney Amber Rumpf.  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
In Case #22CF166 Prelim-Waiver and Arraignment is held: 
--Mr. Anderson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
Attorney Rumpf requests that a refusal hearing not be scheduled at this time; the parties are working toward a resolution of the cases.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Rumpf
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on April 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 2:08 PM 
Defendant Kyle P Anderson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia
--No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
recess 2:11 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/13/22 at 1:00pm (2)Preliminary Hearing on 5/24/22 at 8:30am
